item.title: Total Fire Ban advice for 3 January 2023
item.description:
Content:

The following alert has been issued by the Department of Fire and Emergency Services (DFES).


Time of issue: 05:05 PM
Date of issue: 02 January 2023

Total Fire Ban affecting Midwest Gascoyne, Perth Metropolitan, Goldfields Midlands, South West, Great Southern for 3 January 2023

A Total Fire Ban has been declared for 3 January 2023 for the local government districts listed below:

Midwest Gascoyne Region:

  • Carnamah - All Day
  • Chapman Valley - All Day
  • Coorow - All Day
  • Dandaragan - All Day
  • Greater Geraldton - All Day
  • Irwin - All Day
  • Mingenew - All Day
  • Moora - All Day
  • Morawa - All Day
  • Northampton - All Day
  • Perenjori - All Day
  • Three Springs - All Day
  • Victoria Plains - All Day

Perth Metropolitan Region:

  • Armadale - All Day
  • Chittering - All Day
  • Gingin - All Day
  • Gosnells - All Day
  • Kalamunda - All Day
  • Mundaring - All Day
  • Serpentine Jarrahdale - All Day
  • Swan - All Day

Goldfields Midlands Region:

  • Beverley - All Day
  • Bruce Rock - All Day
  • Cunderdin - All Day
  • Dalwallinu - All Day
  • Dowerin - All Day
  • Goomalling - All Day
  • Kellerberrin - All Day
  • Koorda - All Day
  • Laverton - All Day
  • Menzies - All Day
  • Merredin - All Day
  • Mount Marshall - All Day
  • Mukinbudin - All Day
  • Narembeen - All Day
  • Northam - All Day
  • Nungarin - All Day
  • Quairading - All Day
  • Tammin - All Day
  • Toodyay - All Day
  • Trayning - All Day
  • Wongan Ballidu - All Day
  • Westonia - All Day
  • Wyalkatchem - All Day
  • Yilgarn - All Day
  • York - All Day

South West Region:

  • Bunbury - All Day
  • Capel - All Day
  • Collie - All Day
  • Dardanup - All Day
  • Harvey - All Day
  • Murray - All Day
  • Waroona - All Day

Great Southern Region:

  • Boddington - All Day
  • Brookton - All Day
  • Corrigin - All Day
  • Cuballing - All Day
  • Kondinin - All Day
  • Kulin - All Day
  • Narrogin - All Day
  • Pingelly - All Day
  • Wagin - All Day
  • Wandering - All Day
  • West Arthur - All Day
  • Wickepin - All Day
  • Williams - All Day
  • Woodanilling - All Day

At these times you must not:

  • Light, maintain or use a fire in the open air
  • Carry out any activity that could start a fire

This includes:

  • Open fires for the purpose of cooking, camping or outdoor entertainment are not allowed including fire pits and bonfires.
  • Hot work such as metal work, grinding, welding, gas cutting is not allowed in the open air except for business and industry if regulatory conditions are met.
  • Off-road activity using a four-wheel drive, quad bike, motorcycle, bobcat or similar vehicle, except for agricultural purposes or by business and industry if regulatory conditions are met.


If a Harvest and Vehicle Movement Ban has been imposed by your local government, off-road activity for agriculture or business and industry including harvesting is banned. Exceptions are made for essential services.

For a list of activities that can or cannot be carried out during a Total Fire Ban and conditions visit www.dfes.wa.gov.au/totalfirebans or by telephoning the Total Fire Ban Information Line on 1800 709 355.

You could be fined up to $25,000 or jailed for 12 months or both if you breach a Total Fire Ban.

Current Total Fire Bans are also available by visiting www.emergency.wa.gov.au/#totalfirebans

END
Media Contact: DFES Media and Corporate Communications on 9395 9543.

item.title: Total Fire Ban advice for 2 January 2023
item.description:

item.title: Total Fire Ban advice for 1 January 2023
item.description:
Content:

The following alert has been issued by the Department of Fire and Emergency Services (DFES).


Time of issue: 04:16 PM
Date of issue: 31 December 2022

Total Fire Ban affecting Pilbara, for 1 January 2023

A Total Fire Ban has been declared for 1 January 2023 for the local government districts listed below:

Pilbara Region:

  • Karratha - All Day

At these times you must not:

  • Light, maintain or use a fire in the open air
  • Carry out any activity that could start a fire

This includes:

  • Open fires for the purpose of cooking, camping or outdoor entertainment are not allowed including fire pits and bonfires.
  • Hot work such as metal work, grinding, welding, gas cutting is not allowed in the open air except for business and industry if regulatory conditions are met.
  • Off-road activity using a four-wheel drive, quad bike, motorcycle, bobcat or similar vehicle, except for agricultural purposes or by business and industry if regulatory conditions are met.


If a Harvest and Vehicle Movement Ban has been imposed by your local government, off-road activity for agriculture or business and industry including harvesting is banned. Exceptions are made for essential services.

For a list of activities that can or cannot be carried out during a Total Fire Ban and conditions visit www.dfes.wa.gov.au/totalfirebans or by telephoning the Total Fire Ban Information Line on 1800 709 355.

You could be fined up to $25,000 or jailed for 12 months or both if you breach a Total Fire Ban.

Current Total Fire Bans are also available by visiting www.emergency.wa.gov.au/#totalfirebans

END
Media Contact: DFES Media and Corporate Communications on 9395 9543.

item.title: Total Fire Ban advice has changed for 30 December 2022
item.description:
Content:

The following alert has been issued by the Department of Fire and Emergency Services (DFES).


Time of issue: 07:19 PM
Date of issue: 29 December 2022

Revocation of Total Fire Ban

The Total Fire Ban declared for 30 December 2022 has been revoked for the local government districts listed below:

Perth Metropolitan Region:

  • Gosnells

This information is also available by calling 13 DFES (13 3337) or visiting www.emergency.wa.gov.au/#totalfirebans
END
Media Contact: DFES Media and Corporate Communications on 9395 9543.
